00064 namespace phys
00065 {
00066     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00067     /// @class TypedConstraint
00068     /// @headerfile constraint.h
00069     /// @brief This is the base class for all constraints supported.
00070     /// @details This class provides the basis for all the other constraints.  This is
00071     /// also a virtual class and provides no constraint properties of it's own, thus
00072     /// shouldn't/can't be called on manually.
00073     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00074     class PHYS_LIB TypedConstraint
00075     {
00076         protected:
00077             friend class World;
00078             friend class PhysicsManager;
00079             /// @brief First rigid body the constraint applies to.
00080             btRigidBody* BodyA;
00081             /// @brief Second rigid body the constraint applies to(if applicable).
00082             btRigidBody* BodyB;
00083             /// @brief First Actor the constraint applies to.
00084             ActorRigid* ActorA;
00085             /// @brief Second Actor the constraint applies to.
00086             ActorRigid* ActorB;
00087             /// @brief Bullet constraint that this class encapsulates.
00088             btTypedConstraint* ConstraintBase;
00089         public:
00090             /// @brief No initialization constructor.
00091             /// @details The no initialization class constructor.
00092             TypedConstraint();
00093             /// @brief Class destructor.
00094             /// @details The class destructor.
00095             virtual ~TypedConstraint();
00096             /// @brief Two body constructor.
00097             /// @details This constructor is used when the applicable constraint is applied to two bodies, as opposed to a point a world space.
00098             /// @param bodya First actor to be applied to.
00099             /// @param bodyb Second actor to be applied to.
00100             TypedConstraint(ActorRigid* bodya, ActorRigid* bodyb);
00101             /// @brief One body constructor.
00102             /// @details This constructor is used when the applicable constraint is applied to a body and a point in world space.
00103             /// @param bodya The actor to be constraint to a point in world space.
00104             TypedConstraint(ActorRigid* bodya);
00105             /// @brief Gets the first actor this constraint applies to.
00106             /// @return Returns a pointer to the first actor this constraint applies to.
00107             ActorRigid* GetActorA();
00108             /// @brief Gets the second actor this constraint applies to.
00109             /// @return Returns a pointer to the second actor this constraint applies to.
00110             ActorRigid* GetActorB();
00111             /// @brief Provides override of constraint parameters.
00112             /// @details Parameters such as ERP and CFM can be altered with this function.  Optionally provide axis.
00113             /// @param num The parameter to override.
00114             /// @param value The new value for the parameter.
00115             /// @param axis Optional axis.
00116             virtual void SetParam(int num, Real value, int axis=-1) = 0;
00117             /// @brief Gets value of constraint parameters.
00118             /// @details See SetParam() for clarification.  Gets information on constraint parameters.
00119             /// @param num The parameter to get information for.
00120             /// @param axis Optional axis.
00121             /// @return Returns the value for the requested parameter.
00122             virtual Real GetParam(int num, int axis=-1) = 0;
00123     };
00124 
00125     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00126     /// @class ConeTwistConstraint
00127     /// @headerfile constraint.h
00128     /// @brief
00129     /// @details
00130     ///////////////////////////////////////
00131     class PHYS_LIB ConeTwistConstraint : public TypedConstraint
00132     {
00133         protected:
00134             /// @brief Bullet constraint that this class encapsulates.
00135             btConeTwistConstraint* ConeTwist;
00136         public:
00137             ConeTwistConstraint(ActorRigid* ActorA, ActorRigid* ActorB, Vector3 VectorA, Vector3 Vectorb, Quaternion QuaternionA, Quaternion QuaternionB);
00138             ConeTwistConstraint(ActorRigid* ActorA, Vector3 VectorA, Quaternion QuaternionA);
00139             /// @brief Internal constructor.
00140             /// @details Constructs this class around a pre-built bullet constraint.  This is an internal only constructor and shouldn't be called manually.
00141             /// @param Constraint The constraint to be constructed around.
00142             ConeTwistConstraint(btConeTwistConstraint* Constraint);
00143             /// @brief Class destructor.
00144             /// @details The class destructor.
00145             virtual ~ConeTwistConstraint();
00146             void SetAngularOnly(bool AngularOnly);
00147             void SetLimit(int LimitIndex, Real LimitValue);
00148             void SetLimit(Real SwingSpan1, Real SwingSpan2, Real Twistspan, Real Softness=1.0, Real BiasFactor=0.3, Real RelaxationFactor=1.0);
00149             void SetDamping(Real Damping);
00150             void SetMaxMotorImpulse(Real MaxMotorImpulse);
00151             void SetMaxMotorImpulseNormalized(Real MaxMotorImpulse);
00152             void SetFixThresh(Real FixThresh);
00153             void SetMotorTarget(Quaternion Quat);
00154             void SetMotorTargetInConstraintSpace(Quaternion Quat);
00155             void EnableMotor(bool Enable);
00156             bool IsPassedSwingLimit();
00157             /// @brief Provides override of constraint parameters.
00158             /// @details Parameters such as ERP and CFM can be altered with this function.  Optionally provide axis.
00159             /// @param num The parameter to override.
00160             /// @param value The new value for the parameter.
00161             /// @param axis Optional axis.
00162             virtual void SetParam(int num, Real value, int axis=-1);
00163             /// @brief Gets value of constraint parameters.
00164             /// @details See SetParam() for clarification.  Gets information on constraint parameters.
00165             /// @param num The parameter to get information for.
00166             /// @param axis Optional axis.
00167             /// @return Returns the value for the requested parameter.
00168             virtual Real GetParam(int num, int axis=-1);
00169     };

00172     /// @class Generic6DofConstraint
00173     /// @headerfile constraint.h
00174     /// @brief
00175     /// @details
00176     ///////////////////////////////////////
00177     class PHYS_LIB Generic6DofConstraint : public TypedConstraint
00178     {
00179         protected:
00180             /// @brief Bullet constraint that this class encapsulates.
00181             btGeneric6DofConstraint* Generic6dof;
00182         public:
00183             /// @brief No initialization constructor.
00184             /// @details The no initialization class constructor.
00185             Generic6DofConstraint();
00186             /// @brief Inheritance constructor.
00187             /// @details This constructor exists for passing values down the inheritance tree from derived classes.  Should not be called on manually.
00188             /// @param ActorA First actor to have the constraint applied to.
00189             /// @param ActorB Second actor to have the constraint applied to.
00190             Generic6DofConstraint(ActorRigid* ActorA, ActorRigid* ActorB);
00191             Generic6DofConstraint(ActorRigid* ActorA, ActorRigid* ActorB, Vector3 VectorA, Vector3 VectorB, Quaternion QuaternionA, Quaternion QuaternionB, bool UseLinearReferenceA);
00192             Generic6DofConstraint(ActorRigid* ActorB, Vector3 Vectorb, Quaternion QuaternionB, bool UseLinearReferenceB);
00193             /// @brief Internal constructor.
00194             /// @details Constructs this class around a pre-built bullet constraint.  This is an internal only constructor and shouldn't be called manually.
00195             /// @param Constraint The constraint to be constructed around.
00196             Generic6DofConstraint(btGeneric6DofConstraint* Constraint);
00197             /// @brief Class destructor.
00198             /// @details The class destructor.
00199             virtual ~Generic6DofConstraint();
00200             void SetOffsetALocation(Vector3 Location);
00201             void SetOffsetBLocation(Vector3 Location);
00202             void SetLinearUpperLimit(Vector3 Limit);
00203             void SetLinearLowerLimit(Vector3 Limit);
00204             void SetAngularUpperLimit(Vector3 Limit);
00205             void SetAngularLowerLimit(Vector3 Limit);
00206             void SetUseFrameOffset(bool UseOffset);
00207             void SetLimit(int Axis, Real Low, Real High);
00208             void CalculateTransforms();
00209             /// @brief Provides override of constraint parameters.
00210             /// @details Parameters such as ERP and CFM can be altered with this function.  Optionally provide axis.
00211             /// @param num The parameter to override.
00212             /// @param value The new value for the parameter.
00213             /// @param axis Optional axis.
00214             virtual void SetParam(int num, Real value, int axis=-1);
00215             /// @brief Gets value of constraint parameters.
00216             /// @details See SetParam() for clarification.  Gets information on constraint parameters.
00217             /// @param num The parameter to get information for.
00218             /// @param axis Optional axis.
00219             /// @return Returns the value for the requested parameter.
00220             virtual Real GetParam(int num, int axis=-1);
00221     };

00255     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00256     /// @class HingeConstraint
00257     /// @headerfile constraint.h
00258     /// @brief
00259     /// @details
00260     ///////////////////////////////////////
00261     class PHYS_LIB HingeConstraint : public TypedConstraint
00262     {
00263         protected:
00264             /// @brief Bullet constraint that this class encapsulates.
00265             btHingeConstraint* Hinge;
00266         public:
00267             /// @brief
00268             /// @param AxisInA The orientation for the axis(for ActorA) on which the hinge is to act.  For example, a door hinge would be (0.0,1.0,0.0), aka the positive Y axis.
00269             /// @param AxisInB The orientation for the axis(for ActorB) on which the hinge is to act.  For example, a door hinge would be (0.0,1.0,0.0), aka the positive Y axis.
00270             /// @param UseReferenceA By default, this constraint uses ActorB's local space as the reference for certain values, such as the rotational limits.
00271             /// This simply controls whether or not it should use ActorA's local space instead.
00272             HingeConstraint(ActorRigid* ActorA, ActorRigid* ActorB, Vector3 PivotInA, Vector3 PivotInB, Vector3 AxisInA, Vector3 AxisInB, bool UseReferenceA=false);
00273             /// @brief
00274             /// @param AxisInA The axis(for ActorA) on which the hinge is to act.  For example, a door hinge would be (0.0,1.0,0.0), aka the positive Y axis.
00275             /// @param UseReferenceA By default, this constraint uses ActorB's local space as the reference for certain values, such as the rotational limits.
00276             /// This simply controls whether or not it should use ActorA's local space instead.
00277             HingeConstraint(ActorRigid* ActorA, Vector3 PivotInA, Vector3 AxisInA, bool UseReferenceA=false);
00278             /// @brief
00279             /// @param UseReferenceA By default, this constraint uses ActorB's local space as the reference for certain values, such as the rotational limits.
00280             /// This simply controls whether or not it should use ActorA's local space instead.
00281             HingeConstraint(ActorRigid* ActorA, ActorRigid* ActorB, Vector3 VectorA, Vector3 VectorB, Quaternion QuaternionA, Quaternion QuaternionB, bool UseReferenceA=false);
00282             /// @brief Internal constructor.
00283             /// @details Constructs this class around a pre-built bullet constraint.  This is an internal only constructor and shouldn't be called manually.
00284             /// @param Constraint The constraint to be constructed around.
00285             HingeConstraint(btHingeConstraint* Constraint);
00286             /// @brief Class destructor.
00287             /// @details The class destructor.
00288             virtual ~HingeConstraint();
00289             void SetAPivotLocation(Vector3 Location);
00290             void SetBPivotLocation(Vector3 Location);
00291             void SetAngularOnly(bool AngularOnly);
00292             void EnableAngularMotor(bool EnableMotor, Real TargetVelocity, Real MaxMotorImpulse);
00293             void EnableMotor(bool EnableMotor);
00294             void SetMaxMotorImpulse(Real MaxMotorImpulse);
00295             void SetMotorTarget(Quaternion QuatAInB, Real Dt);
00296             void SetMotorTarget(Real TargetAngle, Real Dt);
00297             void SetLimit(Real Low, Real High, Real Softness=0.9, Real BiasFactor=0.3, Real RelaxationFactor=1.0);
00298             void SetAxis(Vector3 AxisInA);
00299             void SetUseFrameOffset(bool FrameOffset);
00300             /// @brief Provides override of constraint parameters.
00301             /// @details Parameters such as ERP and CFM can be altered with this function.  Optionally provide axis.
00302             /// @param num The parameter to override.
00303             /// @param value The new value for the parameter.
00304             /// @param axis Optional axis.
00305             virtual void SetParam(int num, Real value, int axis=-1);
00306             /// @brief Gets value of constraint parameters.
00307             /// @details See SetParam() for clarification.  Gets information on constraint parameters.
00308             /// @param num The parameter to get information for.
00309             /// @param axis Optional axis.
00310             /// @return Returns the value for the requested parameter.
00311             virtual Real GetParam(int num, int axis=-1);
00312     };
